hook.text: Spider silk is five times stronger than steel by weight. We can't farm it.

buildup.text: Spiders are territorial cannibalsâ€”put them together and they eat each other.

discovery.text: Scientists inserted spider genes into yeast and bacteria to brew silk protein.

twist.text: The engineered silk works but spinning it into fibers remains a challenge.

climax.text: If perfected, bio-silk could replace petroleum-based synthetics entirely.

punchline.text: Nature's strongest thread now comes from a lab, not a web.

quiz.question: Why can't we farm spiders for silk?
